question: The number of atoms in 4.5 g of a face-centred cubic crystal with edge length 300 pm is:
(Given density = <katex>$10~g~cm^{-3}$</katex> and <katex>$N_{A}=6.022\times10^{23})$</katex>.
explanation: Volume of unit cell <katex>$a^3 = (3 \times 10^{-8})^3 = 27 \times 10^{-24} cm^3$</katex>. Mass of unit cell = <katex>$d \times V = 10 \times 27 \times 10^{-24} = 2.7 \times 10^{-22} g$</katex>. Number of unit cells = <katex>$4.5 / (2.7 \times 10^{-22}) \approx 1.66 \times 10^{22}$</katex>. Atoms per FCC = 4. Total atoms = <katex>$4 \times 1.66 \times 10^{22} \approx 6.6 \times 10^{22}$</katex>.
